interestingcomments.content: 7 hours ago, sandro said: The R4 seems to be famous for its intricate electronics and when something goes wrong (not so strange after so many years) usually it can't be fixed anymore. My R4 has no problem, I don't use it very often but when I want to it functions as it should. No battery drainage. Take it out of its case and check if the problems continues. If so, I am afraid there may be a problem as mentioned in the previous post. Good luck, Lex Agreed. You've first got to identify categorically whether it's a physical problem with the case activating the camera in an unwanted fashion, or whether it's an electronic problem. Use it without the case for a few weeks, and hope that the problem goes away! Good luck!
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: 7 hours ago, sandro said: The R4 seems to be famous for its intricate electronics and when something goes wrong (not so strange after so many years) usually it can't be fixed anymore. My R4 has no problem, I don't use it very often but when I want to it functions as it should. No battery drainage. Take it out of its case and check if the problems continues. If so, I am afraid there may be a problem as mentioned in the previous post. Good luck, Lex Agreed. You've first got to identify categorically whether it's a physical problem with the case activating the camera in an unwanted fashion, or whether it's an electronic problem. Use it without the case for a few weeks, and hope that the problem goes away! Good luck!

interestingcomments.content: in the past I wrote about problems with contacts in Leicameter MR/MR-4. Recently I encountered yet another reason for problems with contacts, as far as I am aware only later MR-4 are affected. Btw, in analogue CL and M5 Leitz was using ceramic plates as basis for printed circuit - yet another evidence of product superiority Leicameter MR, MR-4 contact problems.pdf
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: in the past I wrote about problems with contacts in Leicameter MR/MR-4. interestingcomments.content: 1 minute ago, Malcolm Kays said: This problem exists with M10, M10-R and M10-M. Only happens when using the Visoflex 020 and Leica have failed to solve the problem despite releasing firmware updates after it was reported by numerous users. Maybe the new version rumoured to be announced with the M11 will solve the problem, if you feel like chancing about £500 on one. Of course if the new one works properly the 020 will have very little resale value with this problem. Haha, thanks for the insights. Guess I'd better to sale my 020 sooner.
